modules.description: Provides operations to create and manipulate literals as signed integers, including negation, absolute value, and sign extraction. Works with a private integer type representing logical literals, where positive values indicate positive literals and negative values indicate their negations. Used to generate string representations, compare literals, and compute hash values for efficient storage and lookup.

Provides SAT solving capabilities through a set of operations that parse DIMACS format, add clauses, and check satisfiability. Works with boolean formulas represented as clauses and variables. Used to integrate automated theorem proving into constraint satisfaction workflows.

manages logical literals through a private integer type, enabling operations like negation, absolute value, and sign extraction. It supports comparison, hashing, and string conversion for efficient handling of logical expressions. Users can generate canonical forms, check signs, and compute unique identifiers for literals. This allows for precise manipulation and representation of logical values in symbolic computation tasks.
